document_data.name: Cuardin
document_data.mainbody: '''Cuardin''' was a small farming town on [[Gwynneth]], adjacent to a forest that surrounded the [[Myrloch Vale]]. Sometime between the 3{{rd}} and 8{{th}} centuries DR, its inhabitants took part in a battle against a [[Northlander]] raiding party, in which the legendary ''[[tools of the common man]]'' were created and played a decisive part.
document_data.Defenses: Prior to their conflict with the Northlanders, Cuardin had no access to any weapons besides repurposed farming equipment.
document_data.Inhabitants:
The people of Cuardin were farmers and herders, and were known to keep [[goat]]s.

Notable among Cuardin's populace were the original bearers of the ''tools of the common man'': [[Shod]], a courageous goat herder who rallied the community into standing up to the Northlanders, wielder of the ''[[Shod's shepherd staff|shepherd staff]]''; [[Gabe]], the quiet but powerful wielder of the ''[[Gabe's shovel|shovel]]''; and [[Boric]], the wise elderly stable worker, wielder of the ''[[Boric's pitchfork|pitchfork]]''.
